channel.title: A problem that started a few days ago
channel.description:
Before I start, I would like to let you know that I am not a newb trying to run a server for the first time, I have been running my server for well over a year. I've been through many troubles along the way. but this one wont give up.
Well a few days ago my server just stopped...everyone was disconnected and no one could log in through the 4 no-ip i have on this computer. I've tried almost everything, I re-port forwarded, restarted my modem and my router several times, I've restored my router to default and port forward I took my firewall COMPLEATLY off, I system restored....still nothing at all.
I very much enjoy running a server, and I wanna keep running my server. I'm not asking for a host nor anything to do with that. I'm just asking for a solution to my problem. I really hope someone can help me. :/ I really hope this isn't the end to my private server career.

item.title: A problem that started a few days ago
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

omg dude same thing happened to me! i went in and tried re port forwarding, tried changing my no- ip and nothing seems to work so i completely quit trying… i just make p servers for fun and give them out lol

Read full topic
item.source: A problem that started a few days ago

item.title: A problem that started a few days ago
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

yes

when you shut down your router

you’re ip might be switched around with the other connections on that router

it happens frequently when im on road trips and such

try the linksys page again

and match your ip with it

run > cmd > ipconfig

Read full topic
item.source: A problem that started a few days ago

item.title: A problem that started a few days ago
item.dc:creator: @wasabiie wasabiie
item.description:
@wasabiie wrote:

hmm, would that be caused by restarting your router?

And I’m sure it’s not a bad code, I check the cmd throughoutly.

Read full topic

item.title: A problem that started a few days ago
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

that’s why you make a backup o.O

sometime’s your external ip changes

change that on linksys port forwarding page?

Read full topic
